captions.text: They're greasy little freaks who hide pickles
in the sky
Miss Fisher don't think that I'm pretty
But I would stuff a sixty cent nacho
in my book
Lines, lines, intersecting
Oh, lines, lines, lines
Intersecting now with paint
I can't hear when you talk
I got cheese candy
I hate the crazy seagulls we won in those stupid frames
Am I glad I keyed that van
Been dreaming I could strangle you and it felt so wonderful
I kiss down really low
I kicked your monkey then I used your goat
I kicked your monkey then I used your goat
A piggy baby leaving Arizona slipped and fell last night
Stuff is shooting out of this hole
But the genie never got me off
I'm fighting with ninja gloves
Been dreaming I could strangle you and it felt so wonderful
No the genie never dumped her load
I'm body snatching you and then I'ma change your diaper
I kicked your monkey then I used your goat! (Monkey!)
I kicked your monkey then I used your goat (Monkey!)
I used your goat (Monkey!)
I kicked your monkey then I used your goat
I used your goat
Yeah, I used your goat
I used your goat
Monkey
(Monkey!)
Can we be friends
Or will you touch me?

title: "Kicked Your Monkey" — A Bad Lip Reading of Gotye's "Somebody That I Used To Know"

comments.author: WilonaTheTreeOfLife

comments.text:
I know you're all going to think I'm crazy, but here I go:

1:25 to 1:35 just makes me bawl my eyes out. It's total nonsense, of 
course, but it's meaningful and wonderful nonsense. It really seems as if 
he's singing about breakup, not about monkeys and cheese candy. To me, it 
sounds like he's saying "We had some great times together, winning crazy 
seagulls at the carnival, but then we had a big fight at the carnival and 
our relationship is all over and done with, water under the bridge, and 
you're just somebody that I used to know." That's what "I hate the crazy 
seagulls we won in those stupid frames/And all the bloody mittens/That were 
lying/Under the harlequin's sofa" sounds like it means to me. Call me crazy.

Also, I think "Been dreaming I could strangle you and it felt so wonderful" 
could be a lyric in a genuine song.﻿
